column4: Shareholders nudge Altera to reopen talks with Intel: Bloomberg
column5: Several shareholders of chipmaker Altera Corp  including Cadian Capital Management and TIG Advisors  have urged the company to resume takeover talks with Intel Corp  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Shareholders nudge Altera to reopen talks with Intel - Bloomberg
column5: April 13 Several shareholders of chipmaker Altera Corp  including Cadian Capital Management and TIG Advisors  have urged the company to resume takeover talks with Intel Corp  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Wall St. declines as worries about earnings deepen
column5: U.S. stocks dipped on Monday as fears increased that the strong dollar and lower oil prices will hurt U.S. first-quarter earnings.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: April 13 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Monday:

column4: Jana Partners pressing Qualcomm to spin off chip business
column5: Hedge fund Jana Partners said on Monday that Qualcomm Inc's chip business was "essentially worthless" at current valuations and pressed the company to spin it off from its patent-licensing business to "restore investor confidence." | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Jana Partners pressing Qualcomm to spin off chip business
column5: * Jana says chip unit "essentially worthless" at current valuation

column5: * Netflix to raise share authorization in step to split stock

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St flat with earnings eyed; Apple  Qualcomm lift Nasdaq

column4: Investor Jana's Rosenstein wants to 'pull levers' to boost Qualcomm
column5: NEW YORK Activist hedge fund manager Barry Rosenstein said on Monday he wants the share price of chip maker Qualcomm  to climb and his hedge fund  Jana Partners  plans to work collaboratively with management to find ways to boost it.

column4: Investor Jana's Rosenstein wants to 'pull levers' to boost Qualcomm
column5: NEW YORK  April 13 Activist hedge fund manager Barry Rosenstein said on Monday he wants the share price of chip maker Qualcomm to climb and his hedge fund  Jana Partners  plans to work collaboratively with management to find ways to boost it.

column4: REFILE-US STOCKS-Wall St to dip at open after three-day run; earnings eyed
column5: April 13 U.S. stocks were set for a slightly lower open after three straight days of gains  as the corporate earnings season was poised to kick into high gear with a slew of reports this week.
